channel.title: Converting my compiler to run on ssh?
channel.description:
[code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\*.java pause[/code]
How would I convert that to run on ssh lol :S

@T41 wrote:

Red Hat Linux 5 it looks like.

wget http://ftp.scientificlinux.org/linux/scientific/55/x86_64/SL/java-1.6.0-openjdk-1.6.0.0-1.11.b16.el5.x86_64.rpm
rpm -i java-1.6.0-openjdk-1.6.0.0-1.11.b16.el5.x86_64.rpm

Still not working?

/usr/sbin/alternatives --install /usr/bin/java java /usr/java/jdk1.6.0_20/bin/java 2
/usr/sbin/alternatives --config java

item.source: Converting my compiler to run on ssh?

item.title: Converting my compiler to run on ssh?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Hash1 Single, post:15, topic:426780”][quote author=t4 link=topic=529479.msg3865284#msg3865284 date=1324952602]

#!/bin/sh
javac -cp ./deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar:./deps/jython.jar:./deps/xstream.jar:./deps/mina.jar:./deps/mysql.jar:./deps/poi.jar:./deps/slf4j.jar:./deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin ./src/server/event/*.java ./src/server/model/items/*.java ./src/server/model/minigames/*.java ./src/server/model/npcs/*.java ./src/server/model/objects/*.java ./src/server/model/players/*.java ./src/server/model/players/skills/*.java ./src/server/model/players/packets/*.java ./src/server/model/shops/*.java ./src/server/net/*.java ./src/server/task/*.java ./src/server/util/*.java ./src/server/world/*.java ./src/server/util/log/*.java ./src/server/*.java ./src/server/world/map/*.java ./src/server/model/players/combat/*.java

There is your script, what distribution are you using?
[/quote]

SSH Secure Shell 3.2.9 (Build 283)
Copyright © 2000-2003 SSH Communications Security Corp - http://www.ssh.com/

This copy of SSH Secure Shell is a non-commercial version.
This version does not include PKI and PKCS #11 functionality.[/quote]
I meant OS distribution - it’s obvious you’re using a unix/linux distro. Try uname -a.

Read full topic

item.title: Converting my compiler to run on ssh?
item.dc:creator: @Hash1_Single Hash1 Single
item.description:
@Hash1_Single wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:12, topic:426780”][quote author=Hash1 Single link=topic=529479.msg3865100#msg3865100 date=1324942803]

screen wtf why

idfk l0l0l0

Paste:

#!/bin/sh
javac -d out src/*.java

Into make.sh

Then make it executable:

chmod +x make.sh

To execute script:

./make.sh

/bin/sh: javac -d out src/*.java: No such file or directory [root@vps Server]# [root@vps Server]#

made the make.sh into one line, dno if that affects anything

yes. also, i didn’t include all of your arguments - so you’ll need to fix that: just add them after -d out and separate the external libraries by : instead of ;. Use / instead of . also, please don’t operate your server under root.

its @ /root/Server

[root@vps Server]# sh make.sh
make.sh: line 2: javac: command not found
[root@vps Server]#
[/quote]
root is an account.

Do you have Sun JDK/openJDK installed?[/quote]

I installed regular java, no jdk lol

Read full topic

item.source: Converting my compiler to run on ssh?

item.title: Converting my compiler to run on ssh?
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

The term you’re looking for is shell, not ssh. You’re converting batch (.bat) to shell (.sh).

Change all of the C:\Program Files… to your jdk directory on the machine you’ll use this shell file on.
Replace any semi-colons with colons.

Remove the @echo off

Replace the pause with "read -p “Press any key to continue…”

[hr]

Any problems, post back.

Read full topic
item.source: Converting my compiler to run on ssh?
